newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits little changed in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits little changed in late trade.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were steady to easier in lacklustre trade with most traders sidelined due mainly to an absence of fresh incentives, dealers said on Monday.

"Rates were steady to a little bit softer in the morning on some position adjustments. There was no fresh news and most people are sitting on the sidelines, reluctant to open or hold new positions," a local dealer said.
"But some people are waiting for more clues to market direction from this Friday's release of the (U.S. September) durable goods report," he said.
In day-to-day rates, Monday/Tuesday, Tuesday/Wednesday and week-fixed eased 1/16 percentage point each to a common 5-1/4 5-1/8 percent, respectively.

Among longer dates, one-month was unchanged from last Friday's 5-3/8 5-1/4 percent, three-months unchanged at 5-1/2 5-3/8, six-months unchanged at 5-5/8 5-1/2 and twelve-months unchanged at 5-13/16 5-11/16 percent.
